tuv.seg: Dealing with the deceased's estate
Deileáil le hEastát an Mhairbh
This document describes the process of administering a deceased person's estate in Ireland
Tá cur síos an seo ar an gcóras a bhaineann le heastát an mhairbh a riaradh

Issues regarding the right of access to the deceased person's estate, the rights of spouses/civil partners and family members and what happens if the deceased person has not made a will are all described in What happens the deceased's estate

Tá cur síos sa mhír Céard a tharlaíonn do mhaoin an mhairbh ar na cearta atá ag daoine i dtaobh eastát an mhairbh, cearta an chéile/páirtnéirí sibhialta agus baill eile an teaghlaigh agus céard a tharlaíonn sa chás nach bhfuil uacht déanta ag an duine atá básaithe

If there is a will and an executor has been appointed, then the executor deals with the estate. This means that they make sure that the spouse/civil partner is aware of the right to a legal right share and distributes the estate in accordance with the will and the law

Má tá uacht ann agus seiceadóir ceapaithe, ansin is faoin seiceadóir atá sé deileáil leis an eastát, déanamh cinnte go bhfuil a fhios ag an gcéile/páirtnéirí sibhialta go bhfuil sciar dleathúil ag dul aige/aici mar cheart agus dáileann an seiceadóir maoin an eastáit de réir na huachta agus an dlí
If there is no will, or, if there is a will but there is no executor, an administrator is appointed - usually the next of kin or a solicitor
Muna bhfuil uacht ann, nó má tá uacht ann ach níl aon seiceadóir ann, ceaptar riarthóir - is iondúil gurb é an gaol is giorra nó dlíodóir a cheaptar ina riarthóir
The Law Society of Ireland has published a useful guide (pdf) on the administration of estates
Tá treoir úsáideach (pdf) ar riarachán eastát foilsithe ag Dlí-Chumann Corpraithe na hÉireann
If there is a will, then the executor needs to take out probate
Má tá uacht ann ní mór ansin don seiceadóir iarratas a dhéanamh ar Dheonú Probháide

If there is no will, or, if no executor has been appointed or the appointed person cannot act, an administrator may be appointed and they take out a Letter of Administration (or a Letter of Administration with Will Annexed if there is a will)

Muna bhfuil aon uacht ann, nó, muna bhfuil seiceadóir ceapaithe nó muna féidir leis an duine atá ainmnithe ina s(h)eiceadóir feidhmiú, is féidir riarthóir a cheapadh agus déanann sé/sí iarratas ar Litir Riaracháin
The duties of the executor and administrator are broadly the same
Mórán na dualgais chéanna atá ar sheiceadóir agus ar riarthóir
If the estate is complex, it may be advisable to appoint a solicitor to do the job
Má tá eastát casta i gceist d'fhéadfadh sé gur fiú dlíodóir a cheapadh leis na dualgais a chur i gcrích

They will be paid out of the estate and will usually charge around 3% of the value of the estate (or less on very large estates). If matters are fairly straightforward, the executor/administrator may decide to make a personal application

Íocfar é/í as an eastát agus is iondúil go ngearrtar tuairim is 3% de luach an eastáit ar an tseirbhís seo (nó níos lú ar eastáit an-mhóra) Má tá rudaí simplí go leor is féidir leis an seiceadóir/riarthóir iarratas a dhéanamh é/í féin

Taking out probate basically means having the Probate Office or the appropriate District Probate Registry certify that the will is valid and that all legal, financial and tax matters are in order so that the executor or administrator can be allowed to get on with the job of distributing the estate

Iarratas chuig an Oifig Phrobháide deimhniú go bhfuil uacht bhailí ann agus go bhfuil gach gnó dleathúil, airgeadais agus cánach in ord atá i gceist le probháid. Is féidir ansin leis an seiceadóir nó riarthóir dul ar aghaidh agus an t-eastát a roinnt mar is cóir
"Proving" the will is the process by which the Probate Office accepts that the will is valid and may be put into effect
Déanann an Oifig Phrobháide an uacht a "Dheimniú" agus mar sin a ghlacann an oifig gur uacht bhailí atá inti agus gur féidir dul ar aghaidh leis na tiomnachtaí a chur i gcrích
The Office may carry out some enquiries, for example, it may ask to see the witnesses to the will but this does not always happen
Dfhéadfadh sé go ndéanfaidh an oifig roinnt fiosrucháin, e.g., d'fhéadfadh sé go mbéifí ag iarraidh castáil le finnéithe na huachta ach ní tharlaíonn seo i gcónaí
If you don't make a will, an administrator must be appointed
Muna bhfuil uacht agat ní mór riarthóir a cheapadh
An administrator is also appointed where an executor is not named in the will, dies before the testator or is unwilling or unable to act
Ceaptar riarthóir freisin nuair nach bhfuil aon seiceadóir ainmnithe san uacht, má tá an seiceadóir básaithe roimh an tiomnóir, muna féidir nó muna mian leis an seiceadóir feidhmiú
The next of kin may apply for a grant of administration
Is féidir leis an ngaol is giorra iarratas ar dheonú riaracháin a dhéanamh
Priority is given in the following order:
Tugtar tús áite mar seo a leanas:
• Spouse or civil partner
• do chéile nó do pháirtí sibhialta,
If there is doubt about who is entitled to be the administrator, the issue will be decided by the Probate Registrar
Má tá amhras ann cé atá i dteideal a bheith ina riarthóir, déanfaidh an Cláraitheoir Probháide cinneadh ar an gceist
Usually, an administrator is required to give an administration bond to the Probate Office - this is a sort of guarantee that you will carry out your duties properly
Go hiondúil iarrtar ar an riarthóir banna riaracháin a thabhairt don Oifig Phrobháide - le cinntiú go gcomhlíonfaidh sé/sí a d(h)ualgais mar is cóir
Any person may oppose a grant of probate or a letter of administration
Is féidir le duine ar bith cur i gcoinne Deonú Probháide nó Deonú Litir Riaracháin
If you have an objection, you may lodge a caveat (objection) in the appropriate District Probate Registry or at the Probate Office
Má tá tú ag iarraidh dul ina choinne is féidir é sin a dhéanamh trí iarratas a chur chuig an gClár Probháide Dúiche cuí nó ag an Oifig Phrobháide
To make a personal application you must attend in person
Chun iarratas pearsanta a dhéanamh, ní mór duit dul ann tú féin
The Probate Office has discretion to refuse to allow a personal applicant to be attended by an adviser
Tá sé faoin Oifig Phrobháide a dhiúltú chun cead a thabhairt d'iarratasóir pearsanta ligean do chomhairleoir freastal air/uirthi
It may also refuse to allow an applicant to personally continue an application if it had been initiated by a solicitor
Ina theannta sin, d’fhéadfaidís cead a dhiúltú d’iarratasóir chun leanúint go pearsanta le hiarratas má chuir aturnae tús leis

Where an application is made in connection with a case that has already been before the courts, that application must be made by a solicitor unless a special direction is received from the Probate Office
Sa chás go ndéantar iarratas i gcónascadh le cás a bhí os comhair na gcúirteanna cheana, ní mór an t-iarratas sin a dhéanamh ag aturnae mura bhfaightear ordú speisialta ón Oifig Phrobháide
The Probate Office will help an executor/administrator who is acting personally
Cabhróidh an Oifig Phrobháide le seiceadóir/riarthóir atá ag gníomhú go pearsanta
A personal applicant for probate or for administration of the estate must take the following steps:
Ní mór d’iarratasóir pearsanta ar phrobháid nó ar riarachán an eastáit dul i mbun na mbeart a leanas:
Get the form for personal applicants (Form PA2) from the Probate Office or one of the 14 local Probate Offices and fill it out
An fhoirm le haghaidh iarratasóirí a fháil (Foirm PA2) ón Oifig Phrobháide nó ó cheann de na 14 Oifig Phrobháide áitiúla agus í a chomhlánú
See guidance notes PA3
Féach ar nótaí treorach PA3
You also need Inland Revenue Affidavit (Form CA24)
Ina theannta sin, teastaíonn Mionnscríbhinn Ioncam Intíre (Foirm CA24) uait freisin

Fill out 2 copies of the Revenue Affidavit form as best you can by entering details of the deceased's estate such as bank, post office, building society accounts, property, assets, stocks, shares, debts

Comhlánaigh 2 chóip d’fhoirm na Mionnscríbhinne Ioncaim a mhéid agus is féidir leat trí shonraí faoi eastát an mhairbh a iontráil, ar nós bainc, oifig an phoist, cuntais chumainn foirgníochta, réadmhaoine, sócmhainní, stoc, scaireanna, fiachas
See guidance leaflet CA25
Féach bileog threorach CA25
Sign and swear both copies of the Revenue Affidavit before a practising solicitor or a commissioner for oaths
Sínigh agus dearbhaigh an dá chóip den Mhionnscríbhinn Ioncaim i láthair aturnae cleachtach nó coimisinéir mionnaí
(One copy of the affadavit, as well as any other relevant information, will be sent by the Probate Office to the Revenue Commissioners after Probate is granted.)
(Seolfaidh an Oifig Phrobháide cóip amháin den mhionnscríbhinn, mar aon le haon fhaisnéis ábhartha eile, chuig na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim tar éis go ndeonaítear Probháid.)
Return the personal application form to the Probate Office along with:
An fhoirm iarratais phearsanta a sheoladh ar ais chuig an Oifig Phrobháide mar aon leis an méid a leanas:
- the 2 copies of the Revenue Affadavit
- an dá chóip den Mhionnscríbhinn Ioncaim
- a photocopy of the will and codicil/s (if any)
- fótachóip den uacht agus den chodaisíl/codaisíleacha (más ann dóibh)
- any other necessary document, for example, official copy of divorce decree
- aon doiciméad eile riachtanach, mar shampla, cóip oifigiúil d’fhoraithne colscartha
The Probate Office will contact you if there are other requirements or issues
Rachaidh an Oifig Phrobháide i dteagmháil leat más ann d’aon riachtanais nó saincheisteanna eile
If the Probate Office is satisfied it can process the application you will get an acknowledgement and an estimated waiting time for an appointment
Má tá an Oifig Phrobháide sásta gur féidir leo an t-iarratas a phróiseáil, cuirfear seo in iúl duit mar aon le tréimhse mheasta feithimh le haghaidh coinne
In due course you will be given an appointment for interview
Tabharfar coinne duit le haghaidh coinne in am trátha
(More than one appointment may be necessary.)
(D’fhéadfadh go mbeadh gá le breis agus agallamh amháin.)
Attend the interview in person and bring the following required items:
Freastail ar an agallamh tú féin agus tabhair leat na míreanna riachtanacha a leanas:
- proof of identity, such as your passport
- Cruthúnas aitheantais, ar nós do phas
- original will and codicil/s (if any), as well as 3 copies of each
- an uacht agus an codaisíl/codaisíleacha bhunúil/bunúla (más ann dóibh), mar aon le 3 chóip díobh
- statements up to the time of death of deposits in banks, post offices, credit unions, building societies, etc
- ráitis a fhad le tráth an bháis ar thaiscí i mbainc, oifigí poist, comhair chreidmheasa, cumainn foirgníochta etc
- details of other assets (for example, assurance policies, gratuities, superannuation schemes, stocks, shares, cash, prize bonds, etc.)
- sonraí faoi shócmhainní eile (mar shampla, polasaithe árachais, aiscí, scéimeanna aoisliúntais, stoic, scaireanna, airgead tirim, duaisbhannaí etc.)
- details of any liabilities or debts such as outstanding mortgages, loans, wages due to staff
- sonraí faoi aon dliteanais nó fiachais, ar nós morgáistí, iasachtaí gan íoc nó pánna atá le híoc le baill foirne
(You may have to put an advertisement in the papers asking creditors to send in their claims within a certain period.)
(B’fhéidir go mbeadh ort fógra a chur sna nuachtáin ina n-iarrtar ar chreidiúnaithe a n-éilimh a sheoladh ar aghaidh laistigh de thréimhse áirithe.)
- details of any debts owing to the deceased's estate (wages, holiday pay, court case settlements, etc
- sonraí faoi aon fhiacha atá le híoc le heastát an mhairbh (pánna, pá saoire, réitigh chásanna cúirte, etc
- details about property (valuation required) together with title deeds or copy of land registry folio
- sonraí faoin réadmhaoin (teastaíonn luacháil) mar aon leis na gníomhais teidil nó cóip fóilió Chlárlann na Talún
If an administrator, rather than an executor, is applying for a grant, an administration bond may have to be provided
Má tá iarratas á dhéanamh ar riarthóir, seachas seiceadóir, ar dheontas, d’fhéadfadh go mbeadh gá le banna riaracháin a chur ar fáil
The surety (guarantor) for the administration bond must be worth the gross value of the estate
Níor mhór gurbh fhiú an t-urra (ráthóir) don bhanna riaracháin oll-luach an eastáit
Swear the Executor's oath
Mionn an tSeiceadóra a mhionnú

This is an oath swearing that they believe that the will in question is the last will of the deceased, that they are the person appointed as executor and that they will administer the will in accordance with the law

Seo mionn a mhionnaíonn go gcreideann sé/sí gurb í an uacht atá faoi chaibidil uacht deiridh an mhairbh, gurb é/í an duine a ceapadh mar an seiceadóir agus go ndéanfaidh sé/sí an uacht a riar i gcomhréir leis an dlí
An administrator swears a similar oath
Déanann riarthóir mionn atá cosúil leis seo a mhionnú
Pay the fee for probate
An táille don phrobháid a íoc
If the Registrar of the Probate Office is satisfied that the will is valid and there are no caveats (objections) entered then probate will be granted (or letters of administration)
Má tá Cláraitheoir na hOifige Probháide sásta gur bailí don uacht agus nár iontráladh ann aon caveat (aighneachtaí), deonófar probháid ansin (nó Litir Riaracháin)
If there are problems (for example, if the original will cannot be found or there is doubt about signatures) then the Registrar may require sworn statements from witnesses
Más ann d’fhadhbanna (mar shampla, murar féidir an uacht bhunúil a aimsiú nó má táthar amhrasach faoi shínithe) d’fhéadfadh an Cláraitheoir iarraidh ar na finnéithe ráitis faoi mhionn a sholáthar
If there are no problems, the grant of probate or administration is issued on the oath of the executor or administrator
Murab ann d’aon fhadhbanna, eiseofar an Deonú Probháide nó Riaracháin ar mionn an tseiceadóra/riarthóra
The Probate Office or the District Probate Office will make a standard form of grant unless there is a contentious aspect to the application
Déanfaidh an Oifig Phrobháide nó an Oifig Phrobháide Dúiche deonú d’fhoirm chaighdeánach mura mbaineann aon rud conspóideach leis an iarratas

Where a contentious issue arises, the matter must be decided by the High Court judge in charge of probate matters although the High Court can direct that the matter be resolved by the Circuit Court in certain circumstances

Sa chás go n-eascraíonn saincheist chonspóideach, ní mór do bhreitheamh den Ard-Chúirt cinneadh a dhéanamh faoin ábhar, cé gur féidir leis an Ard-Chúirt a ordú go réiteoidh an Chúirt Chuarda an t-ábhar faoi chúinsí áirithe
You can find more information on personal applications on the Courts Servce website
Is féidir leat breis eolais a fháil ar iarratais phearsanta ar láithreán gréasáin na Seirbhíse Cúirteanna

Generally, you are obliged to distribute the assets as soon as possible after the death (within a year if possible - you may be sued by the beneficiaries if you do not distribute the estate within a year)

Go ginearálta, tá dualgas ort sócmhainní an mhairbh a dháileadh chomh luath agus is féidir tar éis a b(h)áis (taobh istigh de bhliain más féidir - is féidir leis na tairbhithe an dlí a chur ort muna ndáileann tú an t-eastát taobh istigh de bhliain)
This may not be possible if there are legal issues to be decided)
Má bhíonn ceisteanna dleathúla le socrú ní gá go mbeidh sé seo indéanta
You are under a duty to preserve the assets of the deceased until they are distributed and to protect the assets from devaluation
Tá dualgas ort sócmhainní an té atá básaithe a chosaint go dtí gur féidir iad a dháileadh agus na sócmhainní a chosaint ó díluacháil
For example, you should make sure that all assets are properly insured
Mar shampla, ní mór duit a chinntiú go bhfuil árachas cuí ar aon sócmhainní go dteastaíonn a leithéid uathu
You have power to:
Tá sé de chumhacht agat:
• Deal with the estate (for example, to sell it to pay debts or distribute amongst beneficiaries)
• déileáil leis an eastát (mar shampla, é a dhíol le n-íoc as aon fhiacha nó leis an luach a roinnt idir na tairbhithe)
• Represent the deceased in legal actions and to settle legal actions against the deceased's estate
• ionadaíocht a dhéanamh don té atá básaithe in aon ghníomhachtaí dleathúla agus gníomhachtaí dleathúla i gcoinne eastát an mhairbh a shocrú
• Gather together and protect all the deceased's assets such as money, shares and property and find out their combined value
• sócmhainní uilig an mhairbh a thabhairt le chéile agus iad a chosaint (airgead, scaireanna, maoin & rl) agus luach a fháil orthu le chéile
• Call in any outstanding funds due (money owing to the deceased)
• aon chistí a sheasann amach a lorg (airgead atá ag seasamh amach don mharbh)
• Pay any debts or taxes owed
• aon bhillí nó cáin atá le n-íoc ag an marbh a íoc
• Pay the funeral expenses
• costais na sochraide a íoc
• Make sure that the spouse (or civil partner) and children know about their legal right share
• déanamh cinnte go dtuigeann an céile/páirtí sibhialta agus na páistí faoina sciar dleathúil
• Make sure the entitled beneficiaries or next of kin get what they are entitled to, and that ownership of property is passed on correctly
• déanamh cinnte go bhfaigheann na tairbhithe cuí nó na gaolta gairide a bhfuil ag dul dóibh agus go dtiteann úinéireacht maoine chuig na daoine cuí mar is cóir
If the deceased was receiving a social assistance payment, you must inform the Minister for Social Protection of the death before distributing the estate
Má bhí íocaíocht cúnaimh shóisialaigh dhá fháil ag an té a cailleadh ní mór an bás a chur in iúl don Aire Coimirce Sóisialaí roimh maoin an eastáit a roinnt
This is to allow the Minister to reclaim any overpayment of pension that may have been made
Déantar é seo le cead a thabhairt don Aire aon íocaíocht pinsin iomarcaigh a thógáil ar ais
The Department has 3 months to decide whether or not an overpayment was made
Tá sé mhí ag an Roinn cinneadh a dhéanamh an bhfuil airgead le n-íoc ar ais
You can read more about social welfare requirements in the Department's document on estate cases
Má theipeann ort teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an Roinn d'fhéadfadh sé go mbeidh ort féin aon aisíoc a dhéanamh
You transfer land by way of an "Assent" to the beneficiary under the will or under the Succession Act
Is ar bhonn aontaithe a aistrítear úinéireacht talún chuig an tairbhí atá ainmnithe san uacht nó de réir rialacha atá leagtha síos san Acht Comharbachta
An assent must be in writing
Ní mór don aontú a bheith i scríbhinn
If you are the beneficiary, it is not absolutely necessary for you to vest the property in yourself by way of an assent (as technically the property already vests in you)
Más tú an tairbhí freisin níl sé riachtanach úinéireacht maoine a aistriú chugat féin le haontú (mar go teicniúil tá an mhaoin sin dílsithe agat cheana)
However, it is recommended practice that you do so in order to facilitate any future selling of that land
Ach, moltar duit é seo a dhéanamh i gcás talún ar mhaithe leis an talamh sin a dhíol go héasca as sin amach
The executor/administrator is not required to deduct and pay the Capital Acquisitions Tax (CAT) due from the beneficiaries before passing on the bequest
Níl dualgas ar an seiceadóir/riarthóir an Cháin ar Fháltais Chaipitiúla (CFC) a asbhaint nó a íoc atá dlite ó na tairbhithe sula gcuirtear ar aghaidh an réadtiomnú
When probate has been granted, the Probate Office sends a copy of the Revenue Affadavit to the Revenue Commissioners
Nuair a bhíonn an phrobháid arna deonú, seolann an Oifig Phrobháide cóip den Mhionnscríbhinn Ioncaim chuig na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim
The Revenue Commissioners will then issue a Form IT38 to each beneficiary who it understands may have a requirement to pay and file a CAT return
Eiseoidh na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim Foirm IT38 do gach tairbhí a dtuigeann siad is gá tuairisceán CFC a íoc a chur i gcomhad
The obligation to pay and file a return rests with the beneficiary
Is faoin tairbhí atá an dualgas chun tuairisceán a íoc agus a chur i gcomhad
See Revenue's Guide to completing the IT38 return
Féach Treoir na gCoimisinéirí Ioncaim maidir le tuairisceán IT38 a chomhlánú
Someone who is a beneficiary under an Irish will has to supply a Personal Public Service (PPS) number before a grant of probate can issue
Má chailltear an duine agus é/í dóchmainneach nó muna bhfuil dóthain airgid ann leis na tiomnachtaí ar fad a íoc, déantar na híocaíochtaí seo ón eastát san ord seo:
If the deceased dies in debt
• coastais sochraide, tiomnacha agus riaracháin
If the deceased dies insolvent or there isn't enough money to meet the bequests made, payments from the estate are prioritised in the following order: 1
• creidiúnaithe a bhfuil urrúis acu i leith na maoine i bhfoirm morgáiste, táille nó lian (bealaí difriúla le hiasachtaí a chur faoi urrús iad seo)
2. Creditors who have security against the property of the deceased in the form of a mortgage, charge or lien (these are different ways of securing loans) 3
• rátaí agus cáin atá le n-íoc ar bhás an tiomnóra, pá agus tuarastal a bhaineann le hobair a déanadh ar son an té atá básaithe taobh istigh de cheithre mhí ó am an bháis

Rates and taxes due at the testator's death, wages and salary for work done for the deceased within four months of death and sums payable by the estate in respect of contributions payable by the deceased in the twelve months prior to death under social welfare legislation (their own PRSI contributions as well as PRSI contributions for employees)

Suimeanna atá le n-íoc ag an eastát maidir le ranníocaíochtaí a thiteann ar an marbh sa dhá mhí dhéag roimh an mbás faoin reachtaíocht leasa shóisialaigh (a c(h)uid ranníocaíochtaí ÁSPC féin chomh maith le ranníocaíochtaí ÁSPC fostaithe)
4. All other creditors
• na creidiúnaithe eile ar fad
Where the deceased dies in debt, creditors can only bring a claim against the estate of the deceased
Nuair a chailltear duine le fiacha is féidir leis na creidiúnaithe éileamh a dhéanamh ar an airgead i gcoinne an estáit amháin

Even if there isn't enough money in the estate to meet all the debts, the relatives of the deceased are not personally responsible or liable for the deceased's debts (unless, of course they had guaranteed them)

Fiú muna bhfuil dóthain airgid san eastát leis na fiacha ar fad a íoc, ní thiteann na fiacha ar ghaolta an mhairbh go pearsanta agus ní gá doibh iad a íoc. (ach amháin sa chás go bhfuil na fiacha urraithe acu)
Contact the Probate Office to obtain the personal application probate form
Déan teagmháil leis an Oifig Phrobháide leis an bhfoirm iarratais phearsanta phrobháide a fháil
This form is for use by personal applicants only
Úsáideann iarratasóirí pearsanta amháin an fhoirm seo
It is not for use by those applying through a solicitor
Ní úsáideann iad siúd a dhéanann iarratas trí aturnae an fhoirm seo
This application form is also available from your District Probate Registry
Tá fáil ar an bhfoirm seo freisin ó do Chlárlann Phrobháide Dúiche
Staff in the Registry will be able to provide assistance
Beidh baill foirne sa Chlárlann in ann cúnamh a chur ar fáil
The application, along with the required documentation, should be returned to the Registry in the area where the deceased lived at the date of death
Ba cheart an t-iarratas, mar aon leis an doiciméadúchán riachtanach, a sheoladh ar ais chuig an gClárlann atá sa cheantar inar chónaigh an marbh tráth dháta an bháis
Obtaining a copy of a will
Cóip d’uacht a fháil
Once a grant of probate (or letters of administration) has been issued, anybody can apply for copies of the grant and the will using Form PAS1 (pdf)
A luaithe a eisítear deonú probháide (nó litreacha riaracháin), féadfaidh aon duine iarratas a dhéanamh ar chóipeanna den deonú agus den uacht trí úsáid a bhaint as Foirm PAS1 (pdf)
The grant sets out the name and address of the executor or administrator of the estate and the name of the solicitor acting on their behalf (if any)
Leagtar amach sa deonú ainm agus seoladh sheiceadóir nó riarthóir an eastáit agus ainm an aturnae a ghníomhaíonn thar a gceann (más ann dó/di)
It also sets out the gross value and the net value of the estate
Leagtar amach ann, chomh maith, oll-luach agus glanluach an eastáit
Detailed information about the estate is not normally available to the general public, however, certain people may be able to inspect the Inland Revenue Affidavit
Ní gnách go mbíonn faisnéis mhionsonraithe ar fáil don phobal i gcoitinne faoin eastát, ach b’fhéidir go mbeidh daoine áirithe in ann an Mhionscríbhinn Ioncam Intíre a scrúdú, áfach
• A beneficiary who is named in the will
• Tairbhí atá ainmnithe san uacht
• Someone who is entitled to a share of the estate
• Duine éigin atá i dteideal sciar den eastát a fháil
• A child who is entitled to bring proceedings against the estate under Section 117 of the Succession Act 1965
• Leanbh atá i dteideal imeachtaí a thionscnamh i gcoinne an eastáit faoi Alt 117 den Acht Comharbais, 1965
Information on obtaining a copy of a will is available on the Courts Service website as well as in the information notes of Form PAS1
Tá faisnéis ar chóip d’uacht a fháil ar fáil ar láithreán gréasáin na Seirbhíse Cúirteanna, agus i nótaí faisnéise Fhoirm PAS1
